TITLE: Tesla made headlines in 2022, but the top-performing auto stock had nothing to do with EVs
SUMMARY: The year in automotive stocks wasn't just about Elon Musk and Tesla. There were losses across the board, but some didn't lose so much.

TITLE: The fintech reckoning is upon us. Here’s what to expect next year
SUMMARY: Many fintech startups will be forced to shutter or sell themselves as they run out of funding in 2023, according to investors, founders and investment bankers.

TITLE: Putin attempts to undermine oil price cap as global energy markets fracture
SUMMARY: Oil markets are more "divided, more politically charged" than ever — but are likely to shake off Russia's export ban announcement in the short term.

TITLE: Global economy is heading into a decade of low growth, economist says
SUMMARY: The global economy likely faces a decade of sluggish growth, according to Daniel Lacalle, author and chief economist at Tressis Gestion.

TITLE: A long-term illness crisis is threatening the UK economy
SUMMARY: The number of "economically inactive" people — those neither working nor looking for a job — between the ages of 16 and 64 has risen by over 630,000 since 2019.

TITLE: Crypto exchange Kraken to shutter its Japan operations after global layoffs
SUMMARY: Crypto exchange Kraken said Wednesday that it will stop operations in Japan next month, blaming a "weak crypto market globally."

TITLE: A former exec from Stripe and Uber is 'OK to give up 100x growth' to build a new business that will last
SUMMARY: Vidit Agrawal of Indonesian startup GajiGesa says crazy growth is nice. But staying power is better.

TITLE: 73-year-old pays $370/month to live in a plane he bought for $100,000 from a salvage yard: 'I have no regrets'
SUMMARY: Bruce Campbell bought the 1,066-square-foot, 200-passenger Boeing 727 from a salvage company in 1999 for $100,000.

TITLE: U.S. weighs new measures for travelers from China as infections surge on mainland
SUMMARY: The U.S. officials noted Malaysia is also taking measures while India and the WHO have expressed their concern about the situation in China.

TITLE: Zelenskyy, BlackRock CEO Fink agree to coordinate Ukraine investment
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and BlackRock CEO Larry Fink have agreed to coordinate investment in rebuilding Ukraine, Kyiv announced Wednesday

TITLE: Dow headed back below 30,000, slim chance of soft landing for economy in 2023: CNBC CFO survey
SUMMARY: CFOs expect the Dow Jones Industrial Average to fall below 30,000 and the economy to enter a recession next year, according to a CNBC survey.

TITLE: Prevent burnout by spotting these red and green flags before taking the job
SUMMARY: While burnout is caused by a variety of factors, one thing remains in your control — the company that you choose to work for.

TITLE: China's plans to scrap Covid quarantine rules is a win for key Club holdings
SUMMARY: China's latest move to roll back its zero-Covid policy by scrapping quarantine restrictions for travelers is the last leg of recovery we've been waiting for.

TITLE: Tesla's stock is headed for its worst month, quarter and year on record
SUMMARY: Tesla shares slid 11% on Tuesday with investors continuing to flee the electric vehicle maker and CEO Elon Musk.

TITLE: Stop complaining, says billionaire investor Charlie Munger: 'Everybody's five times better off than they used to be'
SUMMARY: The billionaire investor can't understand why people today aren't more content with what they have, especially after the struggles of previous generations.

TITLE: Chinese EV maker Nio cuts delivery guidance for fourth quarter, citing Covid disruptions
SUMMARY: Nio had expected to deliver up to 48,000 EVs in the fourth quarter, but Covid-linked supply chain issues pushed the Chinese company to cut its guidance.

TITLE: An Indian tech unicorn's founders share 3 tips for success — including a 'hit by a bus' plan
SUMMARY: The founders of sports tech start-up Dream Sports explain why workers who reach out to other employees during "unplug" time must pay a fine of about $1,200.

TITLE: China turns to lemons, peaches and traditional medicine in wake of Covid wave
SUMMARY: Covid cases in China saw a spike following the country's relaxation of strict Covid rules - but so are the prices of TCM and certain fruits.

TITLE: Here are the countries Chinese tourists want to visit the most
SUMMARY: Now that China is set to reopen its borders, locals are rushing to plan overseas travel for the Lunar New Year in late January, according to Trip.com Group.

TITLE: Chinese provinces hit hard by Covid are seeing a strain on critical care, health officials say
SUMMARY: Some Chinese provinces' intensive care beds and resources are nearing capacity as Covid-19 infections soar, national health authorities said Tuesday.

TITLE: IBM beat all its large-cap tech peers in 2022 as investors shunned growth for safety
SUMMARY: The 111-year-old hardware, software and consulting conglomerate is benefiting from changing investor sentiment and a preference for cash over growth.

TITLE: 2023 could be another difficult year for the auto industry – here's why
SUMMARY: Supplies of new cars are finally improving. But will the automakers have to cut prices to find enough buyers?

TITLE: Shares of China-based funeral company are surging as Covid infections spike
SUMMARY: Hong Kong-listed shares of China's biggest cemeteries operator and funeral service rose to their highest level in more than a year amid a brutal Covid wave.

TITLE: China to scrap quarantine for international travelers in an essential end of zero-Covid
SUMMARY: China announced Monday that starting Jan. 8, 2023, travelers will no longer need to quarantine upon arrival on the mainland.

TITLE: 3 signs the 'pandemic economy' ended in 2022—even though Covid is still around
SUMMARY: The Covid-19 pandemic changed a number of Americans' money habits. But not all of those changes were built to last.

TITLE: Privacy and crypto will likely lead tech policy under split Congress as hope for passing ambitious antitrust reforms dwindles
SUMMARY: With split control of Congress next year, bipartisanship will be key to passing tech reforms.

TITLE: The benefits and risks of using a password manager to protect your online identity
SUMMARY: Consumers with password managers are less likely to experience identity theft, but choosing an online identity protection service requires some thought.

TITLE: Hit by climate change, farmers in Cambodia are risking everything on microfinance loans
SUMMARY: Crop failures from erratic weather and wildfires are leading farmers to take out loans to survive, with their land — and therefore livelihood — as collateral.

TITLE: A nutritionist shares the best snacks to bring on a plane to boost your immune system
SUMMARY: Skip the onboard pretzels and soda, say health professionals who share ideas on ways to lower your chances of getting sick while traveling.

TITLE: The world's in a 'polycrisis' — and these countries want to quash it by looking beyond GDP
SUMMARY: For a small but growing network of countries, the world's go-to metric of economic health is no longer fit for purpose.
